channel.title: onion service name must be 16 characters long - can't reach Whonix onion repository
channel.description:
> SOCKS proxy socks5h://localhost:9050 could not connect to deb.dds6qkxpwdeubwucdiaord2xgbbeyds25rbsgr73tbfpqpt4a6vjwsyd.onion (0.0.0.0:0) due to: Invalid hostname: onion service name must be 16 characters long (1)
Got this reported privately. Haven't seen this before. Did anyone ever see this before?
apt-transport-tor might have a bug not being compatible with sub domains (`deb.`)?

item.title: onion service name must be 16 characters long - can't reach Whonix onion repository
item.dc:creator: mig5
item.description:
A 16-character onion address is a ‘v2’ (legacy) onion service e.g kkkkkkkkkk63ava6.onion

It implies the user is not using a version of Tor compatible with the longer v3 (prop224) addresses/protocol.

Read full topic
item.source: onion service name must be 16 characters long - can't reach Whonix onion repository
